title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: outlines propose change CAFTA. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("signorinoy/CAFTA", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to CAFTA
text: Please note CAFTA project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: function creates alias Surv function survival package, allowing used without explicitly referencing package namespace.

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
code: Surv(   time,   time2,   event,   type = c("right", "left", "interval", "counting", "interval2", "mstate"),   origin = 0 )

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: time follow-time subject. time2 ending time interval (applicable). event status indicator, normally 0=alive, 1=dead. values allowed. type Character string specifying type censoring. Possible values "right", "left", "interval", "counting". origin origin counting time, used type = "counting".

title: Alias for Survival Function — Surv
text: Surv object representing survival data.

what: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
text: Fits accelerated failure time (AFT) model using collaborative analysis survival data.

title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
code: cafta(   formula,   data,   dist = c("weibull", "loglogistic", "lognormal"),   robust = FALSE,   init,   ... )

title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
text: formula formula object specifying model. response must survival object created using Surv function survival package. data data frame containing variables model. dist character string specifying distribution used. Choices "weibull", "loglogistic", "lognormal". Default "weibull". robust Logical; TRUE, computes robust (sandwich) covariance estimates. Default FALSE. init Optional numeric vector initial values parameters. supplied, defaults used. ... Additional arguments (currently unused).

title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
text: object class "cafta" containing: theta Estimated parameter vector. hess Estimated Hessian matrix. cov Estimated covariance matrix. formula model formula. dist distribution used. robust Logical indicating robust covariance used. call matched call.

title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta
text: function fits accelerated failure time model using maximum likelihood estimation. supported distributions Weibull, log-logistic, log-normal. Robust covariance estimation available via robust argument.

title: Collaborative Accelerated Failure Time Analysis (CAFTA) — cafta

what: Extract Model Coefficients from a cafta Object — coef.cafta
title: Extract Model Coefficients from a cafta Object — coef.cafta
text: method extracts estimated coefficients object class cafta.

title: Extract Model Coefficients from a cafta Object — coef.cafta
Extract Model Coefficients from a cafta Object — coef.cafta
text: object object class cafta. ... Additional arguments (currently ignored).

title: Extract Model Coefficients from a cafta Object — coef.cafta
text: numeric vector containing estimated coefficients.

title: Objective Function for CAFTA — objective
text: Computes penalized negative log-likelihood, gradient, Hessian accelerated failure time models parametric distributions (Weibull, log-logistic, log-normal). function also allows robust covariance estimation.

title: Objective Function for CAFTA — objective
code: objective(   par,   time,   status,   x,   theta,   hess,   dist,   robust = FALSE,   eps = .Machine$double.eps )

title: Objective Function for CAFTA — objective
text: par Numeric vector parameters. time Numeric vector observed survival censoring times. status Numeric vector indicating event occurrence. x Numeric matrix covariates. theta Numeric vector prior means parameters (penalization). hess Numeric matrix, prior Hessian matrix penalization. dist Character string specifying distribution. One "weibull", "loglogistic", "lognormal". robust Logical; TRUE, computes robust covariance estimate attaches attribute. eps Numeric; small value avoid division zero log zero, default machine's double precision epsilon.

title: Objective Function for CAFTA — objective
text: numeric value representing penalized negative log-likelihood. result attributes: gradient Gradient vector objective function. hessian Hessian matrix objective function. covariance (robust = TRUE) Robust covariance estimate.

title: Objective Function for CAFTA — objective
text: Computes penalized negative log-likelihood specified accelerated failure time model. returned value includes attributes "gradient" "hessian" use optimization routines. robust = TRUE, robust covariance estimate attached "covariance" attribute.

what: Print Method for CAFTA Summary Objects — print.summary.cafta
title: Print Method for CAFTA Summary Objects — print.summary.cafta
text: function provides custom print method objects class summary.cafta. displays function call formatted table coefficients, including standard errors, test statistics, p-values.

title: Print Method for CAFTA Summary Objects — print.summary.cafta
code: # S3 method for class 'summary.cafta' print(   x,   digits = max(3, getOption("digits") - 3),   signif.stars = getOption("show.signif.stars"),   ... )

title: Print Method for CAFTA Summary Objects — print.summary.cafta
text: x object class summary.cafta, typically result call summary() CAFTA model object. digits minimum number significant digits used printing numeric values. Defaults max(3, getOption("digits") - 3). signif.stars Logical; TRUE, significant stars printed alongside p-values. Defaults getOption("show.signif.stars"). ... Additional arguments passed methods.

title: Simulated Survival Data Set — sim
text: data frame containing simulated survival times, censoring indicators, covariates use survival analysis.

title: Simulated Survival Data Set — sim
text: data frame variables: id Observation ID. time Observed survival time. status Event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored). x1 Standard normal covariate. x2 Normal covariate, correlated 0.3 x1. x31 Dummy x3 = 1. x42 Dummy x4 = 2. x43 Dummy x4 = 3. x44 Dummy x4 = 4. group Group (1–6), sample sizes: 500, 300, 100, 50, 50, 50.

title: Simulated Survival Data Set — sim
text: data set generated 1050 samples, using regression coefficients (0.15, -0.15, 0.3, 0.1, -0.1, 0.3). Event times drawn Weibull distribution (shape = 0.8, scale = 0.3), censoring times uniform distribution maximum 3.2.

text: object class summary.cafta, list containing: coefficients matrix columns estimate, standard error, z value, p-value coefficient. call function call produced cafta object.

what: Calculate Variance-Covariance Matrix for cafta Objects — vcov.cafta
title: Calculate Variance-Covariance Matrix for cafta Objects — vcov.cafta
text: Computes variance-covariance matrix objects class cafta. robust slot object TRUE, robust variance-covariance matrix calculated using sandwich estimator. Otherwise, standard variance-covariance matrix computed inverse Hessian matrix.

title: Calculate Variance-Covariance Matrix for cafta Objects — vcov.cafta
Calculate Variance-Covariance Matrix for cafta Objects — vcov.cafta
